titles.title: Recognizing National Homeownership Month and the importance of homeownership in the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Mr. Miller, Gary moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 415.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 358 - 0 (Roll no. 231).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 6/17/2002--Passed House without amendment. Supports the goals and ideals of National Homeownership Month (June 2002). Recognizes the importance of homeownership in building strong communities and families in the United States.
